text: Bottle with thanks to Youri! Pours hazy hazel, small beige head, good lacing. Aroma is bourbon, raison, cocoa, vanilla, cherry. Flavor is fully sweet, light plus bitter. Medium body, soft mouthfeel. A bit hot, but very good.
Brown. Quite sweet. Loads of caramel. Smoothest barleywine ive ever had.  Smooth bourbon.  Vanilla.  Shared w Aaron and erin. Thx youri.

500ml bottle bought at brewery a few months ago. Aroma: caramel nicely integrated with this bourbon goodness (including lots of vanilla). Some dark red fruits are also part of this party. App: clear brown with off white head leaving little lacing which is ok for the style. Taste and palate: medium to full body, smooth bourbon, lots of vanilla in mouth, sublet bitter and alcohol burning finish. Overall: let me preface this by saying Im not the biggest fan of bw as I often find bw too strong and big. This one is well made. So easy to drink despite its sweetness. It tastes so good! Lots of stuff in there : caramel, nuts, vanilla, a bit of coffee minus the bitterness, etc. I can say this is an amazing barley wine despite Im not a fan of the style. Guess, I shouldnt have traded my other bottles. Again, great job HF.

Poured a darker ruby red with a minimal tan head. Aroma was of dark fruits, oak, caramel, light booze. Flavor similar, sticky, caramel, dark fruit, integrated barrel. Really easy drinking barleywine, but not the best inthe world.
Ok so I normally dont like barleywine but this is the best one I have had. Edged out BA Mouflan b1. Caramel, toffee, butterscotch. So smooth.
Bottle shared thanks to Art. Poured hazy dark brown with min beige head. Aroma sweet malty bourbon barrel. Light carb med thick bod. Tastes quite sweet good barrel, very smooth easy to drink.

Pours a rich, clear brown with a bit of white head. Sweet malty aromas, caramel, oak, bourbon. Quite smooth and pretty sweet. It has some nice complexity, all the flavors really blend well together. Sweet caramel, a bit of chocolate, strong bourbon boozy presence but in a complementing vs obtrusive way. It hits you in the cheeks then coats and lingers with a sweet, smooth malty-boozy finish.

Notes: Bottle picked up at the brewery Dec 16, opened May 17

Thanks thanks thanks thanks (ty x infinity) to Huhzubendah for sharing the bottle! Poured into a taster showing translucent caramel brown with half a finger of caramel foam. 

The nose shows sweet notes of caramel, raisin, and a light oak mintiness. 

The palate is full bodied and lightly carbonated. Light alcoholic heat, perfectly balanced sweetness showing figs, honey, red apples, with a harmonious bourbon note of vanilla throughout the background. My god, this is the best barleywine Ive had... yet.

Many thanks Geist! Pours a bright clear caramel reddish brown with minimal cream head that fades. Aroma is caramel, apples and boozy sweetness. Flavor is unbelievable with a creamy carbonated mouthfeel - easily the best barleywine Ive had.

So glad I traded for this. Amazing. Light copper body with a small head that rapidly fades. The flavor is sublime. Perfect. Lovely, elegant sweetness that could never become cloying. So delicious its difficult to pace oneself. My highest recommendation.

2014 bottle (batch 1). Mellow yet delectable nose of toffee, light cherry, heavy vanilla, and oak, with a touch of brown sugar. Occluded reddish-brown pour. Slightly fruit forward sip with plums and dark cherry tones with sweet bourbon and burnt sugar. Very smooth but rather faded; I wouldve liked to try it in its prime.
500ml 2016. Caramel, brown sugar, candied anything. Malty with a good barrel presence but very smooth. Awesome BW.
aroma was a bit of a letdown on this bev. took away from the beautiful appearance on the pour. still recommend.

500mL bottled 9/8/16, acquired from the brewery, drunk 2/3/17.Light tan head showing moderate to moderately-strong retention tops a clear, caramel-tinted mahogany body with some deep magenta hues and a good clarity.Caramel, chocolate and vanilla all boast a complex, rich maltiness with delightfully well-expressed bourbon right beside it. Its a good mix of rich oak and spicy bourbon character that is almost perfectly balanced by the malt. Only a touch of heat, with no sharp booze or any heavy tannin/coconut/pineapple. Its very clean and polished and you cant deny the malt richness here. Fruitiness is minimal, with mostly some moderate raisin and fig character, but the dark fruit-like vinousness here is very minimal.Malty, as expected, in the mouth with a soft, chewy, comforting, malty texture that allows caramel, light milk chocolate, vanilla, nougat and raisin plenty of room to roam on the palate. Bourbon is classy and restrained, but excellently expressed nonetheless, showing spice and wood and no harsh ester/alcohol sharpness. Definitely rich and sumptuous and obviously tending towards the sweet side, but I can respect that and the beer is so well-executed and polished that, as usual with Hill Farmstead, I find myself giving a high rating to a style I generally hate.
[2/3/17] Bottle at a hotel bottle share in Boston. Deep amber-brown. Malt, caramel, vanilla, cookies, dark fruits, a bit of maple, sweet, rounded mouthfeel, a bit boozy. Really good.
Bottle @ Aaron for Aaron. Very murky amber, bronze pour with a tiny head. Tons of sweet malts, dried dark fruits, plums, figs, vanilla, caramel, some light maple and some warming alcohol.
Bottle. Brown pour with light head. Sweet, spice, light bourbon and vanilla aromas. Flavors are sweet, vanilla, bourbon, light boozy tones.

500ml thanks to Eric. Pours dark amber small head. Nose great caramel awesome hops. Taste great caramel and piny hops. Awesome balance. Big tasty but so well rounded. Very light alcohol. Smooth and complex. Very well balanced. World class. Nice raisins. Awesome stuff.

Pours unclear dark brown with a tiny head. Aroma of dark dried sweet fruits, ripe plums, sweet bourbon, maple, toffee, sweet bourbon and sweet Malts. Taste is sweet and syrupy with lots of maple, slight honey and caramel. Also some dark sweet fruits, bourbon, ripe plums and an alcoholic bite. This is really nice and elegant.

Bottle shared. Pours hazy reddish brown with a small light brown head. Aromas of sweet caramel, chocolate, vanilla, fudge, malty backbone, lots of dark fruits. Taste is caramel, toffee, maple, honey like notes, butterscotch, dark fruits, booze.

From bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares short edition Ft. Aaron. Pours a clearish dark reddish brown with a small off white head. Aroma has just MASSIVE bourbon, fruity bourbon! Plums, vanilla, tobacco, toffee, booze, caramel, coconut, candied pineapple, almost some rum notes. Taste is really sweet, sticky, very low bitterness but slight toasty, and almost a hint of fruity acidity. Oily texture, average carbonation and a boozy finish. Intense stuff!

Bottle dated 09/06/2016.
This was poured into a tulip.
The appearance was a dark brown color with a thin layer of off white foamy head dissipated at a good pace. No lacing.
The aroma had some sweet bourbon, vanilla, slight wood, lush plum sweetness, and a light tobacco quality (far underneath).
The flavor yields to the blend of the sweetness of the previously mentioned aromas with way less tobacco (seems barely there). Sweet plum to bourbon aftertaste strolling into the finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a fair sipping quality about it. Mild carbonation, surprisingly enough given the date, I thought there would have been a tad more, but this was exceptionally smooth with zero cloying.
Overall, as much as I love Sucaba by Firestone Walker, as far as English barleywines this one just takes the cake. Apparently, the beer I want to die with in my hands. But for my personal tribute, RIP Aaron Robards my beer mentor, I wish I could have drank this with you.

At the Barleywine event. B2. Aroma is caramel, toffee, bourbon, barrel, sweet and wonderful. Appearance is brown amber, light brown head, slight haze. Taste is amazing. Sweet caramel, toffee, barrel, booze, wonderful. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy body, light carbonation, caramel and barrel aftertaste. Overall, this is magnificent.

500ml bottle (thx, Hugo!) at my place with Alex and Ash. Bottled on 2016-09-08. Pours a dark brown with a dark beige head. Aroma is bourbon, leather notes, some dark fruits and sour notes. Taste is very sweet (too sweet as for me), with lots of bourbon notes. Very smooth. Great!

Sergeys huntBrown color, small head. Nice malty aroma, but also quite strong alcohol. Sweet malt flavor, deep, rich, but the alcohol is very strong and balances the sweetness; some sweet liquorice, some Bourbon, and more alcohol in the end.Very good, but not very complex, just a muscular beer, I had higher expectations.

Batch 1. Havent had a HF beer in a while so this is a rare treat. Bottle at a tasting - thanks, Kevin! Medium clear brown color with a light khaki head. Aroma is caramel apple, oak, toffee, booze. Medium sweet flavor with sugar, caramel, candy apple, minimal bitterness. Light and drinkable for the style (not light for beers on the whole, pilsners and such). Love it!

Poured from bottle dated 4/20/14 thanks AdamChandler nice brown color with a thin beige head and nice lacing. Aromas of caramel toffee multiple dark fruits brown sugar. Taste is sweet malty layers upon layers perfectly balanced. This is quite a beer.

50cl bottle, I believe Batch 2. Pours a muddy brown with some cloudy, white head. Nose has lots of raisin and caramel, bourbon and booze, wood pulp, a little vanilla. Flavor is malt, caramel, toffee, vanilla, raisin, rum raisin ice cream. Finishes boozy and a bit hot.

500ml bottle purchased at Hill Farmstead. Pours a smooth dark brown, smooth foamy beige head, with micro bubbles, quickly dissipating leaving small lacing. Smells strong bourbon barrel, nice barley scent along with a smooth winyness, small dark fruits like currant. Sweet malty caramel as well. Lovely. Tastes very sweet, caramel malts to boot with a delicious sweet bourbon smoothness. Dark currant and berries come through adding some sweetness. Smooth mouthfeel, great bourbon aftertaste lingering just right. I must say, Im not generally a barleywine fan but this was extremely pleasant to drink. Worth its rating and all the hype. Very, very good.

Dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is dark fruit, bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, brown sugar, hint of booze. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, smooth and balanced on the palate. Taste is chocolate, amaretto, bourbon, brown sugar, dark fruits. So good.
Bottle - Dark toffee and sweetness. Cloudy brown with a decent small beige. Caramel, toffee and an ultra smooth and balanced finish. Although the nose is a bit edgy the taste is all finesse.

500ml bottle, bottled 9/8/16, dark mahogany color, with a tan-coloured head, but falling quickly, very nice fruity bourbonish oak barrel, fruitcake nose, with some light toffee, faint sponge toffee, port wine, light toasted, caramel, biscuity malty, plummy accents, with a dried dark fruit, subtle chocolate, subtle brandy note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate, with a warmth good fruity bourbon, port wine, faint brandy, fruitcake, plum juice character, with some dark dried fruit, faint dark chocolate, fig and date paste, faint toffee, mild toasted, caramel, dark malty, subtle candied black cherry flavours, leading towards a warming fruity bourbon oak barrel, fruitcake, toasted, black maltiness, mild lingering port wine fruitiness finish.

November 7, 2015. Bottle, vintage 2014, shared by _angst_, thanks!
Murky reddish brown with a tiny yellowish head. Aroma is sweet and malt forward with toffee and caramel, prunes, vanilla, toasted coconut, oak, nuts and bourbon. Taste is sweet, malty, light bitter and light warming. Slightly sticky finish with caramel, burnt sugar, dried fruits, light roasted notes, some toasted coconuts and warming bourbon. Full bodied, oily and slight sticky texture, soft carbonation.  
Great, sweet and sticky but not cloying.
Dark brown pour with minimum tan head. Smells like dark fruit, brown toasted sugar. Flavor is prunes, raisins, and a smooth juice. Booze is well hidden.

From notes. Enjoyed at the 3rd Annual Barleywine Tasting at Traviss house on February 20. 500 mL bottle. This one is also in discussion for the best beer of the night. This thing is magnificent. The pour is a dark brown, hints of garnet poking through. There is a nice thick medium khaki head that falls quickly to a collar, leaving no trace. The aroma is great. There is a big sweet malt up front with a nice bourbon to keep it in check. A light vanilla and caramel meld together nicely. There is a good sweetness that almost reminds me of molasses. The booze pokes back through on the finish, stronger than initially. The flavors are wonderful. There is a dark fruitiness up front, a little booze, and then the vanilla and caramel malts come roaring back. Its layered and delicious. The finish is a little boozy again, but the balance is just perfect. The mouth feel is thick and heavy with a soft carbonation that really lets it hang around. The aftertaste is lightly chocolatey, mostly dark fruits and caramel with a lovely bourbon singe that wraps it all up nicely. Im so glad I got to try this. Thanks Travis! Boss status.

bottle shared by a friend. poured a deep brown mahogany colour with a non lasting head. what an amazing perfectly balanced barleywine, so many layers of new flavors. maple syrup, sticky caramel, vanilla, chocolate, belgian pralines, toffee, toasted nuts, sweet raisins, slight fruity aswell. a perfect bourbon balance, the barrel just rounds everything perfect, without getting hot of overwelming. incredible, perfection in its style

Bottle received in trade and split a few ways during the All In Beer Fest. Pours hazy dark reddish brown with a frothy beige head that leaves a small trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is heavy malty with sweet dark bread, caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, caramelized nuts, roasted coconut, moist soil, raisins, prunes and bourbon alcohol. Taste is sweet, tiny bitter, malty and tiny boozy. Mouthfeel is soft, viscous, oily, round, boozy and near full bodied. Finish is sweet and slightly bitter with caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, caramelized nuts, raisins, plums in brandy, moist soil, leather and bourbon alcohol. Sweet but gets away with it due to the extreme fatness and complexity of the beer. A perfect sipper. Very happy to have tried this.

(Bottle) Pours dark brown with a small head. The aroma holds a well integrate bourbon tone and a, for the style, perfect malt bill. Light fruity. The flavour is heavily sweet and medium bitter with a perfect malt profile and yummy bourbon. The mouthfeel is soft, oily and thick with a light carbonation. Full bodied.
Bottle. Pours brown oily with a small head. Aroma is sweet raisins fruity dried figs dark fruits sourish. Flavor is very sweet acidy ashy tannins slightly vinous and boozy, fruity raisins malty.

500 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Originally reviewed 10/6/2014.
 Deep reddish brown. Small off-white head. Medium collar.

Wow. Really complex fruity, oak, and bourbon aroma. Fruity malts. Sweet caramel. The bourbon isnt that strong, but adds a nice component.
 And its even better here. Start off pretty sweet. Lots of sweet fruity malts. Bourbon and vanilla kick in and dull out the sugars a bit. Becomes richer and more brown sugary. The finish is oaky rich with some chocolate in the finish.
Very sweet and heavy. Medium carbonation.
This is a really fantastic beer.

Bottle @ Aarons Wedding Eve Shindig. Thanks, @@. Dark brown in color without much carbonation or foam. Lots of oxidation and barrel character. Big vanilla, chocolate, and caramel in particular. Lots of dark fruits, too. Perhaps a hint of alcohol. Theres a nice sugar and fruity sweetness to the flavor. Good vanilla and milk chocolate. Lots of dark sugar in particular. A little thin and slick on the mouthfeel.

This pours brown and headless in the glass. Its sweet and just a touch soy saucy but nothing too bad. Its full bodied and a bit sticky and some very nice coconut and cherry notes help make up for the slight off-note in the nose. If you like barrel aged barleywines, you will like this one for sure but I feel like its a little too rough around the edges to be truly outstanding.

Bottle shared at my pre-wedding bash with some other RB nerds. Thanks to Matt (TheBeerSommelier) for the trade. Dark brown appearance with a thin brown head. Aroma has some bourbon, candy sugar, caramel, mild chocolate, oak, some tannins, and a bit of dark fruit. A little hot in the mouth but that bad. Pretty complex and fairly sweet. A little bit spicy. Tons of caramel. Drinks pretty good but not in my top five favorite barley wines.

I spilled and drank this beer at the niels pre wedding party bash. Lightly carbonated, dark brown color, with beige head. Aroma of caramelized malts, toffee, bread, and bourbon. Taste is sweet malts, dark fruits, slight bourbon, and bready malts. Drinkable barleywine. Thanks Lenin!

Bottle shared by adnielsen and lenincat. Thanks dudes! Pours a hazy brownish color with white head. Raisins, plums, brown sugar aromas. Brown sugar, molasses, sweet malty flavors. Good, quite syrupy sweet.
Bottle at the Niels bash. Nose is chewy figs and vanilla. Taste is light licorice and soy. Very sweet. Very chewy and sweet. Did I say sweet? Really good. Light alcohol boost.

Finally a great barrel aged barleywine that reminds me of the awesome work Shaun did at Norrebro. Classic example in all sense of the style. Supremely drinkable and balanced barleywine hop with the sweetness of the barrel. Excellent.
Bottle. Pours dark with tan head. Aroma is fruity, figs, raisons, prunes, dried fruits. Taste is medium bodied, medium carbonation, good fruit throughout. Overall, very good.

Bottle. Thanks to Anthony and Matt! Dark brown with a very small head that collects to a ring. Aroma is packed with dark fruit and oak. Some chocolate syrup and caramel too. Kinda smells more like a quad than a barleywine. Tastes moderately sweet and ultra smooth. Lots of raisins, plums, raspberries, and dates. Caramel, chocolate syrup, and maple show up more when it warms. Medium to full body. Syrupy but very smooth mouthfeel. Really great beer.

Bottle: Thanks, Matt! Deep brown pour, nearly black in the center with a very timid, creeping beige collar that forms at the edges. Aroma has tons of woody barrel notes, whiskey, butterscotch, prune & raisin dark fruitiness, thick caramel, bitter cocoa. Flavor is very sweet, sweeter than the nose would indicate, but it balances the booze nicely. Lots of dark fruit, prune, raisin, dates, figs.... Nearly tart for a second, then the caramel malty sweetness comes in riding a strong wave of vanillin, woody oak, toasted nuts, brandy, & light chocolate. Tangy currant vibe. Little bits of butterscotch, anise, molasses, & heavy toffee syrup. Very thick mouth feel, super heavy & sticky. Absolutely delicious stuff. Wow.

Bottle split at Bruces pad - for the last time, massive thanks to that man Leighton, 27/03/15. 
Hazed chestnut brown with a decent beige covering.
Nose is toffee, sweet notes, dark fruit peel, dates, prunes, woody tones, light spice, cocoa nibs.
Taste comprises sweet and bitter notes, dark fruit rinds, toffee fudge, dates, sweet licks, fruit cake mix, raisens.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, sweet licks tempered with subtle bourbon strokes in the close.
Top draw barley wine, barrel ageing is spot on, great balance.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 27th March 2015Swan Song at Bruces. Big thanks to Leighton for this one. Hazy dark amber beer, small cream colour head. Palate is smooth and mildly dry with mild fine carbonation. Sweet malts well integrated with fruity bourbon. Light malt cream. Port Wine like berry fruits on the back end. Smooth finish. Hangs together very well indeed. Soft and approachable, well integrated and tasty. Delightfull!

Bottle share, big thanks to Leighton for the chance to try this one. Dark reddy brown, small ring of tan head, light lacing. Aroma is orange, musty dried flowers, pine. Body is medium, smooth, low carbonation. Taste is very sweet, caramel, sherry, some port, coconut, raisins, some booze coming through in the finish. Pretty smooth stuff.

Bottle shared in London - picked up at the brewery. Pours mostly clear amber-brown with a creamy tan head. Great aroma, lots of well rounded ripe fruits, toffee, rich bread. Big sweet flavor, outrageously smooth, like port, lots of liquefied fruits, raisins, figs, dates, slight vanilla, caramel. Full bodied, creamy, with fine carbonation. Warming finish, sticky sweet, with buckets of liquefied fruits, caramel, more raisins, bread, fruitcake, slight vanilla. Just outrageously drinkable. Superlative.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2015 Bottle thanks to Leighton. It pours deep brown with a small light tan head. The nose is sweet, juicy, vanilla, toasty coconut, fudge, wood, caramelised fruits and candy. The taste is slick, bitter-sweet, plum, glazier cherry, toasty brown sugar, booze, vanilla, wood and candy with a warming finish. Full body, fine carbonation and slick mouth-feel. Too sweet for the likes for me. Great aroma though. Solid.

Bottle at Solar Eclipse, Odense. Clear dark amber body with a small offwhite head. Dark fruit, raisins, plums, figs, light caramel. Sweet, caramel, dark fruit, raisins, figs, bourbon, light yeasty. Sweet and nutty.

Bottle at Solar Eclipse Odense tasting. It pours deep Amber with a creamy small beige head. The aroma is - besides of RARE - toasted malts, biscuits, bourbon, vanilla and oak. Ripe fruit. So complex and enjoyable. The flavor is a great mix of sweet ripe berries, oak, vanilla, bourbon and sweet malts. This is the shit!!
Bottle @ Solar Eclipse Odense, 2015. Pours Cloudy Dark amber with A White head. Nuts, caramel, booze, vanilla and bourbon. Slick and vinhus. Warming. World class.

Bottle. Pours reddish tawny with very small tan head. Aroma is sweet caramel, candied apricot, port, bourbon, butterscotch, toasted grains, prune, sugarcane juice, brandied cherries. Taste is sweet brandy, caramel syrup, cherry juice, licorice, mild roast, bourbon. Very good and amazing that Shaun can brew a barleywine this good with no track record in the style, but still sweet and a little unbalanced to me with a bit too much boozy heat.
Pretty much a perfect barleywine. Pours a dark caramel color. Aromas of caramel, toasted marshmallows, and mild bourbon. Smooth flavir that follows aromas. Finish lingers.

[ Bottle ][ 500ml ][ Trade ][ Tasting ][ Tasting Snifter ][ 2.28.15 ]
>> Flatter tea brownish red pour, weak foam. Nose is vanilla ice cream, bourbon soaked cake, tiramisu, dark and dense bourbon barrel. Taste is sweeter up front with brown sugar, maple, toffee, cookie, tiramisu. Flavor doesnt evolve too much across palate or as it warms- consistent dark dessert flavors minus any roasty flavors or chocolate. Palate is semi-oily, medium-high bodied, neutral oak, moderate to low warming alcohol. Its pretty much everything you can ask for in BA barleywine.
Bottle, Cabana de GT, brown pour, off white head, nose is sweet, nutty, taste is rich, caramel, toffee

500mL bottle, pours a deep dark brown with a small quickly dissipating tan head. Nose is orgasmic, with the most complex bourbon, caramel, brown sugar, wood and some booze. Flavour is incredibly complex and rich, with decadent toffee, brown sugar, moderate bourbon barrel presence, and a heap of caramel. Sweetness factor is fairly high but not cloying. An amazingly decadent, well put together barley wine, whose high sweetness factor only marginally detracts from this being one of the most world class barley wines. Fantastic stuff.
500ml bottle, molasses and sweetness throughout, tons of great bourbon and vanilla flavors.

500 mL bottle, purchased at the brewery. Beautiful dark brown, mahogany pour with solid beige head. Nose and flavor are just divine, with burnt sugar, caramel, molasses, hints of chocolate, ruby port, almond, walnut, vanilla, and present but not overpowering alcohol heat. Rich, complex, long lasting, and decadent. Sweet jesus. What an outstanding barleywine.

Bottle thanks. Pours a cloudy brown with small beige head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is wood, booze, oak. Medium mouth with nice sweet bourbon, wood, caramel, candy sugar, really enjoyed this one.

Bottle shared at the 9th Richmond Rare & Unusual Epic Tasting, Richmond, VA, 11/30/14. Hazy brown with a thin creamy tan head. Good head retention. Aroma of toffee, bourbon, roasted malt and spice. The taste is toffee, caramel, raisin, whiskey, vanilla, dry lemon finish. Medium bodied, mild heat. Nice.

bottle thnx to 77ships ! 
Pours dark brown, good white head . 
Smell is bourbon , oak , sweet grains , taste is heavy , sweet , thick , buttery , vanilla. very nice !

Thanks! Obtained in a trade. Heard about Ameicans drooling about this one, so this one is a nice one to try. 500 ml. (looks like 375 ml.) bottle split with Kraddel. Bottled on 04/2014. Pours black, little tanned head only on the sides. Nose is thick bourbon & surprisingly lots of liquorish, heavy on sugar & spice, cacao. Taste is lots of sugar, dark fruits, light herbal & quite a bit of liquorish, bourbon is more subdued than expected, vanilla, thick prunes, molasses, lots of brown sugar, thick herbal. Body is thick but not overly so, not boozy either. Completely different from what I expected. Lots of unique flavours for the style here, prune, liquorish, fig, herbal etc. This isnt entirely what I prefer but I can respect this.

Bottle. Deep brown with a small head. Nose is rich wood and vanilla,
Cocoa. Some red apple. Almost a tangy fruity flavor. Red apple and cinnamon, toffee. Rich and sweet. Not overly hot. Very good.

Bottle pours with a nice opaque burnt copper body that supports a tan head of foam. The aroma is big yummy goodness. I get soft smooth kettle caramelization, brown sugar coated prunes and figs as well as slick soft bourbon and a flash of oak. The taste is similar as its seductive, rich, slick and soft with a bit of kettle caramelization and then bigger notes of nectar sweet malt drizzled marshmallow blended with thin ribbons of prune and fig like sweet fruity esters. Yum. Toward the finish soft smooth bourbon and supple and molasses sweetened oak come to the surface. Wow! This is bangin on all cylinders.

Good barleywine that seems a bit overhyped to me. Aroma is really nice with toffee, raisin, brown sugar, bourbon, and leather. Taste is very sweet with a lot of raisin and dark fruit with a bourbon booze finish. Complex and flavorful to be sure but really really sweet with raisin flavors and heavy bourbon. Good stuff.
Deep brown color, creamy tan head. Oh my. The caramel, bourbon, vanilla, oak, toffee, raisin flavor is out of control great. Simply a wow.

Bottle split 2 ways. Pours a chestnut color, amber hues. Low carbonation. Small tan head that fades to a ring, and then dissipates slowly. Aromas are bold bourbon, wet oak, vanilla, plums, dates, molasses and brown sugar. Taste follows the nose with an incredible balance of sweetness in the molasses/vanilla/dark fruit...and then some earthiness/nuttiness across the middle before the bourbon leaves a nice warming impression. While the alcohol is remarkably well hidden here, I have to venture a guess that this beer is in the 10.5%-12% abv range. Definitely boosted my buzz before I finished the glass! Great stuff, as is expected from Hill Farmstead.

Bottle: Thanks Vin: Served in a taster:
Thin creamy lacing. Hazy redish brown colored beer.
Aromas of bourbon, malts, cookies, berries and flowers.
Flavours are an amazingly balanced mix of bourbon, honey, barley malts, light sweet, light bitter, cream... Awesomely balanced and smooth!
Aftertaste is smooth bourbon, honey, malts, warm...
Low carbo, silky mouthfeel, close to full body. Smooth!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle shared by my boy Brandon, thanks man! pour is deep, dark brown with a thin tan head. Aroma is so fing rich with loads of maple, bourbon, and brown sugar. So smooth and so rich. Amazing. Flavor is just as silly as the aroma - loads of toffee malt, maple syrup, brown sugar, and bourbon. So big but so smooth and unbelievably not cloying. I am a sucker for BA barleywine, but this is just so good. Just that faintest hint of acidity in the finish to round it all out. Awesome.

Bottle shared @ tasting. Hazy opaque red-brown to black color, small off-white to beige head. Aroma is malts, sweetness, liquor. Taste malts, sweet malts, liquor, strong bourbon, sweetness, overripe fruits. Full body, medium carbonation. Very nice.

Bottle shared thanks to Phillycraft. Pours very hazy brown with a ring tan head. Aroma of vanilla, bourbon, caramel, light raisin and overripe dark fruit, oak. Flavour is heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle at whale sess. Pours black with mocha medium head. Notes are bourbon, raisin, brown sugar, marzipan. little sweet and syrupy with lots of warming effects. Smaller banana and Creme pie flavors. A little hot/sugary for my current palate but Seany killig it again As far as the style is concerned. Maybe a bit more age also?

From notes. Bottle shared by Adam, thanks! Pours medium brown with a scant beige head. Aroma is straight bourbon. Smells really amazing! Flavor is molasses, vanilla oak, raisin. Bourbon comes through on the finish. Rich mouthfeel. Very nice.

500 ml bottle purchased from HFS. Super dark maroon color, massive lace with great aroma. Massive amounts of dried fruit, raisins and very mellow but rich bourbon notes. 
The flavor is a perfectly aged BBA barely wine. Brown sugar, sweet raisins, rich bourbon with vanilla. Mild oak tannins with a creamy texture over the tongue. Perfect amount of oxidation. No Alcohol flavor at all but still has a nice warming sip. Awesome thanks for the share Adam!!

Wow ! Pours a deep rich mahogany color like dark amber maple syrup with a half finger of eggshell foam. This beer is all about layers. Layer upon layer of of well structured silky goodness. Amazing integration of booze and sweetness. Maple syrup, cola, butterscotch, caramel, praline, nutty bourbon so soft and silky. Great mouthcoating flavors with great bourbon structure that kind of keeps the finish from getting too sticky. Ive only had beers with this much complexity coming from megablends... amazed at how good this beer actually is !

500ml bottle shared huge thanks to Lukaduke! Pours dark rich brown with small head. Nose is deep rich dark fruit, caramel, molasses, soft balanced bourbon, touch of boozy sugar spice, plum, raisin. Taste is equally as complex with super silky body, layers of chocolate caramel and dark fruit, Rolos and Butterfinger candy, balanced bourbon, bread. Finish is lasting semi sweet malty caramel bread pudding and vanilla bourbon oak. Unbelievable. A special beer.

Pour is a dark chestnut brown with a tight light brown head. Nose had a lot of bourbon and wood first, the malts are rich, caramel, dry chocolate, touch of maple. Taste is rich, lots of bourbon and slightly charred wood, rich malts, caramel, maple, a bit more berry sweetness in the finish. Full bodied, chewy, assertive carbonation, just a hint oily. Flavor just a bit sweet. Still very rich and bright aromas and flavors, solid stuff!
UPDATED: MAY 25, 2017 Bottle. Pours caramel brown. Tan head. Nose/taste of caramel, toffee, oak, bourbon and dark fruit.  Medium body.

Bottle... Pours mostly clear and copper with a small, creamy, white head. The bouquet is a hot, malty swirl of caramel, maple syrup, ethanol and dates. Full-bodied with a syrupy mouthfeel and lazy carbonation. The flavor is boozy and malty - ethanol, bourbon and caramel with an assortment of dark dried fruits. Warming, boozy finish. This is complex, but red-freaking-hot with alcohol. A long cellaring might really help this baby out. Five months wasnt enough. Cant say its not tasty now, though. Bottle courtesy of landhoney!

50cl, no mention of ABV, new exclusive American brew Anno 2014, thx alot to Dirk for sharing!, very complex brew, sweet/alcoholic/woody and slightly fruity/roasted, yet not too heavy, very balanced, cloudy, nearly no head, very good brew

Bottle. Dark mahagony brown with small beige head. Aroma is rich bourbon, caramel, nuts, maple, figs and other dark fruits. Taste is rich caramel, bourbon, light chocolate and dark fruits. A perfect integration of the barrel. Incredible barleywine.

Une bouteille partagée par SlovakSniper, merci beaucoup. Un liquide acajou, peu de mousse. Un nez très odorant, caramel, barrique (un boisé présent mais jamais envahissant), malt, sirop dérable et raisins secs. Une tonne dodeur. Une bouche terriblement facile pour ce genre de bière, un boisé bien intégré, du malt à la tonne. Superbe.

Bottle generously shared by Seth. Dark brown pour with a kaki head. Big booze and caramel malt aromas. Big booze, caramel malts, and dark fruit highlights. Wow, this is fantastic. Mild oak and vanilla sub tones. Complex with a great body and mouthfeel. An incredible example of this style.....
Bottle - pours dark brown. Smells of caramel, toffee, brown sugar and booze. The taste is burnt caramel, rich malty flavor, and dark fruits. This beer is the tits!!!

Bottle 500ml.
Pours dark brown with very low beige "head". Aroma is of caramel, fruits, alcohol, bourbon, raisins. Taste is of caramel, fruits, alcohol, bourbon. Palate: Full bodied. Sweet. Very nice. Overall: Quite heavy, but pretty good.

Poured from bottle to glass. Dark hue with brown head. Aroma is caramel, toffee, bourbon, oak, vanilla. Mouthfeel is great with a full body and smooth carbonation. Taste is sweet with a nice slight astringent bitterness in the following and a slight ethanol finish. Overall this is a fantastic brew!

pours very dark brown-reddish with a very nice light beige cap, good retention and lacing. dried and sweetened dark fruits - very raisiny, sweet and enticing chocolate, bourbony caramel, never burnt, wood - never overwhelming barrel components - excellent use and integration of bourbon barrels, welcoming astringent notes, sugary but not necessarily cloying - chocolate syrup, maple syrup and molasses, grassy and piney underlying notes. light if not low carbonation, medium to full body - oily and a tad heavy, warming sugary finish. excellent!

Dark brown color, moderate beige head. Boozy aroma of brown sugar (lots of it), figs, dates, wood, caramel apple, grape skin, and cocoa powder. Very sweet, but stops short of being cloying, followed by a little bitterness. Full-bodied and smooth, not particularly heavy, and a long sugary finish.

Bottle shared at tasting. Dark brown pour with thin veil of foam. Aroma is super enticing, tons of raisins, caramelized sugars, roasted nuts, brown sugar, light chocolate, creme brulee. Taste is sweet, but never even close to cloying, rich sweet flavors, like eating a fine dessert. Palate is nice and full bodied but again not too heavy, just the right balance. Very nice, best barleywine I ever had.

Bottle shared by czar, thanks a lot LJ! Pours a medium brown with a small offwhite head that leaves low lacing. Nose is a sugar rush (toffee, maple syrup, brown sugar, you name it) but there is also some good dark fruits in there. Taste is also really sweet, a bit too much for me even. Flavors of caramel, raisins, bourbon and oak are to be found. Body was full, carbonation moderate and some alcohol could be felt but I figure way less than it actually contains. Overall a nice barleywine, not sure why but I may have put my expectations way too high on this one.

Bottle (500 ml). Shared by czar, thanks! Dark brown with mahogany reflects, a small beige head and no lacing. Aroma is of molasses, caramel, dark fruits, vanilla, bourbon and oak along a light nutty presence. Taste is moderately sweet with again molasses and caramel along dried raisins, vanilla, bourbon, oak and a moderate acidic presence. Full bodied. Moderate carbonation. Smooth and almost creamy mouthfeel. Light lingering vanilla finish. Alcohol is well hidden (though theres no mention of the abv on the bottle). Very good balance and complexity. I wasnt as impressed as my tasting partners, but its definitely a pretty good Barley Wine. I will have to revisit.

500ml bottle poured into my beautiful, new, colorful, HF tulip. Pours deep brown/almost ruby with a smaller, beige head. Aroma of lots of bourbon and oak and vanilla, caramel and toffee and light nuttiness and hints of chocolate, some light bitterness, and maybe a hint of alcohol. Flavor the same with such an incredible blend of the oak and bourbon and malts and a nice note of chocolate on the finish. Smooth texture. Wow, just wow. This is up there with some of the best barley wines ever.

Un liquide sans aucun doute riche avec une surprenante effervescence saine. Pain aux raisins, mélasse, caramel rôti, tire dérable, cuirette et bourbon doux. Le corps est tout simplement indécent, pas certain davoir rencontré une telle corpulence. Moelleux, chatouillant presque avec ses petites bulles sans jamais embourber le palais, un tour de force sensoriel. Les saveurs suivent le nez avec des petits fruits très présent, des coulisses de beurre dérable et une vanilline omniprésente. La buvabilité est égale à sa grosseur, lalcool vraiment furtive.

Thanks to my friend Heather for sharing her glass with me. 

A - Pour is very murky brown woody with a very prune juice appearance which is of course the look of a barley wine so no surprise there. 1 finger milk chocolate head appeared and faded to a thin ring. 

S - Smell is walnut, chestnut, caramel, peanut, vanilla ice cream, figs, maple syrup and toffee. Very decadent aroma. 

T - Obviously whiskey up front, middle and at the finish. The whiskey is long lasting. Theres a lot going on here. Oak tannic vanilla is probably the most substantial and a walnut pistachio mix of nuttiness with rich figs covered in a sweet candy apple sugary taste. Theres a whole lot going on here. Maybe its slightly more sweet than I would prefer but thats my own fault. 

M - Mouthfeel is creamy, dense and oily with a bittersweet naked vanilla finish.

O - The long time in oak has done wonders to this beer. Its perfect right out of the gate. Sure itll change with time but this is ready to drink now. Reminds me of a lot of barleywines after I sit on them for a year after purchase. The 2 years in oak lends a slight oxidation, brings out the oak and vanilla and lets the flavors meld together really well.

Le liquide foncé, acajou pour ce quil me semble, avec la naissance courte ou la mort immédiate dun col mousseux plutôt beige. Un nez orgiaque dans lequel je pourrais bien me perdre pendant de longs moments. Une présence assez cochonne dune barrique caramélisée et vanillée. Des malts gargantuesques. Des raisins secs (et autres fruits) qui trempent dans une liqueur fabriquée, entre autre, avec des noix. Une coulée de sirop dérable et une trace de noix de coco grillée. Une douceur énorme confrontée à des vapeurs dalcool travaillées pour éviter lénormité. Ça sannonce bien! Un goût tout aussi intéressant mais un peu moins profond. Des tonnes de céréales liquoreuses. Un sucre assumé. Un bourbon bienheureux qui fignole les saveurs et qui enchante mes papilles. Un corps qui sinscrit dans la catégorie des poids lourds. Une texture riche et collante qui reflète la teneur en sucre et en alcool du liquide. Un pétillement très mou que je trouve bien adéquat. Une finale maltée brune, noire et fruitée, à mi-chemin entre le porto et autre fabuleux dessert de fin de soirée. En résumé, un vin dorge prêt pour jouer dans la cour des grands. Étonnamment facile à boire pour sa stature et pour sa capacité sucrée. Superbe intégration du fût de bourbon : la base de cette bière doit être tout simplement titanesque.
